title: Intelsat buys capacity on Hispasat’s Amazonas Nexus satellite
summary: Intelsat has acquired a “significant amount” of capacity from the recently launched Amazonas Nexus satellite to meet demand for connectivity over the Americas, an executive for the company told SpaceNews.

title: FCC unveils proposed satellite direct-to-device regulatory framework
summary: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission unveiled its proposed framework March 17 for regulating the use of terrestrial wireless spectrum from space for connecting smartphones beyond the reach of cell towers.

title: ULA Completes Vulcan Tanking Test, WDR Next
summary: The United Launch Alliance (ULA) team has completed the next phase of testing in preparation for the inaugural Vulcan rocket flight.

title: SpaceX begins doubleheader with Starlink mission before launch for SES
summary: Hot on the heels of Tuesday’s successful CRS-27 launch, SpaceX’s Falcon 9 is in action again for a pair of back-to-back missions from both coasts Friday, both of which will deploy communications satellites into orbit.

title: Watch live: SpaceX counting down to sunset launch from Cape Canaveral
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket is poised for launch from Cape Canaveral just after sunset Friday on mission to haul two SES television broadcasting satellites into orbit, continuing a multibillion-dollar program to clear C-band spectrum for terrestrial broadband. SpaceX’s 38-minute launch window opens at 7:38 p.m. EDT (2338 GMT), just four hours after the launch of another Falcon 9 from California.
